fitting_functions¶

class hmf.fitting_functions.Fits(hmf, cut_fit=True)[source]¶

Calculates \(f(\sigma)\) given a MassFunction instance.

The class simplifies the choosing of the fitting function through a simple mapping of string identifiers.

Parameters :

hmf : hmf.MassFunction instance

This object contains everything that is needed to calculate \(f(\sigma)\) – the mass variance, redshift etc.

cut_fit : bool, optional, default True

Determines whether the function is cut at appropriate mass limits, given by the respective publication for each fit. Though it is included in the hmf argument, one can specify it explicitly here for more flexibility.

Methods

nufnu() Calculate and return \(f(\sigma,z)\).
nufnu()[source]¶

Calculate and return \(f(\sigma,z)\).

Internally this uses the string identifier to call an appropriate function.
